intro: Lappa bardana subsp. major, commonly known as greater lappa, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, featuring hairy stems and lobed leaves. Its flowers are yellow and occur in clusters, while the seeds are small and wind-dispersed. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats.
